oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John Barry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Engraving of John Barry (1745-1803), seated at desk in naval uniform with sword and sidearms.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military officers; Uniforms; Daggers & swords; Offices
Barry, John, 1745-1803; United States. Navy--Officers; United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783; United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783 -- American Forces
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Barry was born in Ireland, but his family was driven from their home by the British. Barry was the first to capture a British War Vessel while at sea. After the Revolutionary War Commodore Barry urged the creation of the Department of the Navy. The engraving is from a painting by Alonzo Chappell, an American portraitist.
